subject: event not on map

comments.value:
Human Race: inside the science of sports medicine  --- not showing.  Did something go slightly wrong with the updates you did yesterday?  Or is she being impatient?

Thanks!

From: Ruth Langford-Johnson
Sent: 07 July 2010 08:40
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: Human Race: inside the science of sports medicine

Hi Liz,

The above event is not showing on the map.  I have checked the post code and it is correct...can you look into it for me.

Many thanks

Ruth

Ruth Langford-Johnson
Open Weekend Project Coordinator
Culture, Ceremonies, Education & Livesites
Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 169

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001
london2012.com


P Please consider the environment before printing this email
Marking as high

Hello Liz,
This event was re-published, this morning at 08:39.
We notified Stamen of this at 09:00.
Stamen downloaded the event data shortly afterwards.
However, the event doesn't yet appear on the map.
I have to conclude from this that the delay is at Stamen's end.
I will forward this question to Stamen.
Thanks – I know that sometimes there is a delay with Stamen. My concern was that this event had been previously published some weeks back, so I wasn’t sure if it’s been missing the whole time!

Sent following email to shawn@stamen.com:
=======================
Hello Shawn,

I have another question from the people at London 2012 regarding an event missing from the map.

At 9am this morning, we notified you - via the following url - that an event had changed:

 http://data.map.london2012.com/kitsite-updates.php?path=events/human-race-inside-the-science-of-sports-medicine.php&action=createorupdate&id=2353976
 
However, a hour or so later, it still hasn't appeared on the map (*), even after a series of Ctrl-refreshes. In fact, it seems to have been deleted. Would you be able to let me know whether there is a problem, please?

Kind regards,

Kieran
(*) http://www.london2012.com/map.php - I searched for "human race" (from the title) "Crichton" (fromn the address) and then just for all "Open Weekend 2010" events, and it appeared in none of the results.

sorry to add to this, but there are still loads of seemingly random events that have a date of June appearing on the map.  I've sent to Stamen, but if you could please just double check that there is nothing different in the XML from those events and the ones that are appearing correctly, I would really appreciate it.  Maybe something to do with having no 'end date' or something??

That might be the case but until I hear back from Stamen, it's very difficult to investigate.
There are quite a a few events that have no end date but that DO appear on the map, but I have no way of knowing whether those are ones that Stamen collected recently.
My suspicion is (I think) the same as yours: i.e. they put in a fix to fix the problem whereby incorrect start dates were being shown, however - in doing so - they also introduced a problem that caused events with no end date to be suppressed.
Until I hear from them tho', I just can't tell. I wish I could!
Totally fine – let’s hope they’re on the case!

As far as I can gather, this problem is distinct from the start/endDate problem.
As far as I can tell, Stamen had a problem geolocating the postcode of this particular event.
It still seems to be missing from the map. Oh! I've just had a look, and the event is now expired. I'm presuming this was deliberate?
Time thus far (including the above): 0.2. This time was spent researching the problem, and emailing Stamen.
Hm. Looks like ruth expired it! I’ll make sure it was on purpose! Let’s leave it for now

Ok, closing this ticket. (do re-open if Ruth/other didn't expire it).
Kieran

subject: publishing an uploaded photos image

comments.value:
Bug.  I think? Am I doing something wrong?

[cid:image001.png@01CB19D6.547E9A30]

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012
Hey Liz, did you click on approve or publish in that view?
yep looks like a bug, will investigate...

Publish. But I just tried with the approve button and got this:
[cid:image001.png@01CB19D8.D413D150]
Set to high priority.
I think this is the same bug as the other one?
yes indeed
Cool. So if i publish an image there, do i need to go back to the event and republish for it to show?

I think you need to go into the event and assign the freshly approved picture, save and publish.

Do you have an event for me to have a look at?

I just approved and image for ‘ordsall festival’ and then went into the event page and didn’t see it there. or any mention that the event had an associated photo. should i? Am slightly concerned that the link isn’t there....
Or do i just need to go and find it, manually, by choosing a photo

Liz, i know that you approved one picture for the ordsall event, did you approve any others or could you approve one more for me and let me know which one please?

Thanks!

I’ve now approved a LOT. And i’ve been manually going into each event, finding the photo i approved, changing the picture, and resaving/publishing.

I have approved (but not manually changed):
Brush hill lnr conservation
Happening hankies
Fresh air festival
Contacting the world 2010
Superb thank you Liz!

Sorry it took me a while to write, and you probably assigned some manually but from now on you should be able to make use of this.

But i'm done with this now. Every time an Event is published the workflow will run and try to find a image and assign it to the Event ~ if there isn't one assigned already. I've tested it and it found the correct ones for the ones i tested it with.
p.s. is it possible for these photos to carry the ‘open weekend 2010’ tag, as well?

Cool – so will it only check on publication, or will it show up in the event page in the CMS before publication? We do need to know when there is an image attached so that we can approve/not approve it. Occasionally people submit things that are inappropriate, so I don’t want things going live without anyone knowing/seeing the photo...
Jamie: It's a bug but I am putting this as billable (subject to approval), as it's 2012-specific code. If you disagree, feel free to amend the billing details.

H iDanny,

This is a mix of lots of things and I take your point but need to be careful not to antagonise Liz as she may see it as a bug, bug.

One issue is that we can't actually do what she wants, as we don't have the data / the CMS has some restrictions.

1) If we assign an image to an Event page [when we create it] and then that page gets published, the image gets published (approved or not). So we can't add an "if" on the Event page saying "if image is approved show it" as publishing the event will have forced the image to be approved/published. We possibly could create a custom workflow for OW images but all of the workflow in the current Default workflow would need to be duplicated. This is what we probably need to do but worried about the knock on effect here, is it better to leave it as it is for the time being [and look again next time we do something like this] seeing as most event have already been uploaded.

* I think the above was the original plan but the issue of the image being published when the page was published it was taken out.

2) Ignoring the above, as it makes this point kind of irrelevant, we can't store a reference on the Image back to the Event on the image as:

      a) we create the Event page after the Image, although I suppose we could try and create a unique key which is stored in the image name/filename and a meta-data field on the Event 
      b) we can't set any meta-data on the image other than tags (which show up on the front end), although we could possibly do this via the filename (I think we can set the filename independently of the image name)

3) There are no references on any of the current images or events, so whatever we did now would only be of use for newly uploaded events. We'd also have a clean up job to do as some pages would have a user assigned / image container and new pages a image meta data field and some display code. 

---

If we we're to go down the route (in future);

1) Create image and set the filename to ow-#eventname#-#uniquenumber#.jpg [assuming this is possible? it may not be possibel to set the filename separately form the image]

2a) Save this is a new /uploads/ow folder (so we can separate them out form the normal user uploads) / create a new tab in the CMS
2b) Alternatively add a 'origin' to the upload servlet and filtering to the approval screen.

3) Store the path to this image on the Event in a metadata 'string' field (not an image container or else it will be published)

4) On the Event page check for the existence of a image field, check if an image with that name exists in a given section and then if has been approved display it. In edit mode we may want to indicate that their is an image that needs approval.

--

I know what Liz would really like is a screen where an image could be assign internally or externally, with a little 'approve/reject' tick-box under it for any external images, but can't see that happening as the development costs outweigh the use.

Sorry long email/response, with no clear conclusion..

subject: test cookie based stickyness works on staging server load balancer

comments.value:
Hi Col,

Just did a bit more of an automated test and pleased to say that it working as expected, with cookies enabled I always get sent to the same server, disabled and the servers alternate.

1) Cookies enabled

[jamie@dev ~]$ ./get.sh 
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14

1) Cookies disabled

[jamie@dev ~]$ ./get.sh 
Stage03
Stage04
Stage03
Stage03
Stage04
Stage03
Stage04

Test scripts used:

#!/bin/bash
# cookies enabled
for i in {1..50}
do
wget http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/session-test.php --keep-session-cookies --save-cookies cookies.txt --load-cookies cookies.txt  -O - -o /dev/null | grep Stage | sed -r 's/<h2>Session test - //g' | sed -r 's/<\/h2>Setting session cookie//g'
done

#!/bin/bash
# cookies disabled
for i in {1..50}
do
wget http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/session-test.php  -O - -o /dev/null | grep Stage | sed -r 's/<h2>Session test - //g' | sed -r 's/<\/h2>Setting session cookie//g'
done

I would like this to open a new, smaller pop-up window, as it does in the header nav. Is it possible to set up the link code so that it does this?

Hi Morag,

The small pop up window has a special onClick handler to open it, which we (or you) cant assign to links in rich text areas (it's actually a bit of code rather than HTML markup).

We could look at hardcoding it in the template at the top of the text container, not sure it will work but we can give it a go.

Jamie

The current navigation component is very generic and recursive code shared by almost every page on the site ie. we can't easily just do something different for a given section or least it makes for very messy and unmanageable code if we do that.

What we have done instead is altered the navigation used on the 'Volunteering home' page only.

Although I think that is the only place where the parents sections show anyway?

Jamie

subject: Contact us issue 'could not open socket'

comments.value: People have been calling here complaining that when they submit a contact us form, they receive a message saying 'could not open socket' (see attached).  Is that likely to be something up at you guys' end do you know, or if not do you know what it means?
i'm looking into this!
Did this get fixed?
I'm not sure, investigation led us into thinking that bt needs to configure sendmail on 5 and 6 to fix this ~
looking at it as well in connection with the form touchup story.

The problem is happening earlier than the emailing - it actually dies off when we try to check the recaptcha code. I've temporarily removed the check, which enables the users to send messages, but potentially dangerous.


To properly resolve, someone at BT should kick the dns settings so that this doesn't end up with an error:

[webcontent@olympic-web01 ~]$ host api-verify.recaptcha.net 
;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached

Can someone please forward this to BT? Thank you.

Jag / Gianfranco - this requires action, although i'm not quite understanding it so you're probably better to judge how quickly. Please see summary of conversation between Janos from Kitsite and me re: issues with our 'contact us' form on the website:

FC: People have been calling here complaining that when they submit a contact us form, they receive a message saying 'could not open socket' (see attached). Is that likely to be something up at you guys' end do you know, or if not do you know what it means?

Janos: The problem is happening earlier than the emailing - it actually dies off when we try to check the recaptcha code. I've temporarily removed the check, which enables the users to send messages, but potentially dangerous.


To properly resolve, someone at BT should kick the dns settings so that this doesn't end up with an error:

[webcontent@olympic-web01 ~]$ host api-verify.recaptcha.net
;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached

Can someone please forward this to BT? Thank you.




-----Original Message-----
Has this all been sorted out?
Did this get resolved in the end, Jag? Conversation seems to have tailed off.
Hi Finn, Jag isn't able to respond directly to support tickets here. It is probably best to email him directly.

Cool, wasn’t sure if you guys were able to let me know how far discussions had gone.

Jag – remember the ‘could not open socket’ issue? Where did you get to with that? See below...
any progress? I'd like to close this ticket...
Solved I believe, thought it was already closed actually, soz...

subject: numbers after event name still showing up on map

comments.value:
Any idea why?  Is it one for stamen, or is there some cache, somewhere, that isn't being cleared?

I know there is a way of 'getting into' the Stamen data and forcing an update ... only I can't seem to find those details.  Does anyone over there have it?

[cid:image001.png@01CB1C24.E1A776C0]

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012

There are 22 results for "junk aliens" when searching the map and 12 results when searching in PostCMS. It is possible that links to 11 events since renamed (with another one added subsequently) have not been removed from the map database. Stamen should be getting an update of the renamed events so that they can  be deleted, this appears not to have happened. We are investigating where to problem might be.
Kieran, assigned to you. I hope that is expected.
Thank you! This is a high priority, please!
Kieran: you appear to have fixed this.

This was largely fixed by the end of yesterday (Monday).
In that - the legacy ones were fixed.
By lunchtime today, it was fixed for all future ones.
Basically, the event renames weren't being dealt with properly. They are now.
NB Danny I set billable days to 0.5. Debatable whether we can charge for all of it, but it is an accurate reflection of how much time I spent.

subject: Volunteering website - additional changes

comments.value:
Hello

A few more tweaks to the Volunteering template, please!

Pink include - I can't seem to edit this in either IE8 or FF. Is it possible to change the link to point to 'Volunteer in your area' - http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/other-ways-to-volunteer/volunteer-in-your-area/index.php Also, the rollover link in this module is underlined in black in IE8 but should be white like the text please.

Volunteering info template - please can you remove from this template the feature boxes for Related photos and Related videos

Home page - please remove entirely the pink button which currently says 'Have you got what it takes', plus the 'Related photos' and 'Related videos' boxes

Landing page - we want to remove the promos on this page and extend the picture down, so that it can show a range of different pictures which we are using in the ad campaign, while also featuring one clear link above the fold to 'Enter the site'. I'm not sure if this is something you can do or if I need to send this back to McCann to rework entirely. Can we discuss this?

Home page - media pod - is it possible for me to edit this using the XML? Is this still hosted by McCann? I think we need to ensure this is hosted by us, as we will need to ensure it goes on the cloud ready for launch on 27 July.

Page titles at the top of picture pods all templates - please can you ensure that the headers for the picture pods are bold, as per the home page? e.g. http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/other-ways-to-volunteer/volunteer-in-your-area/index.php 

Blue include for alternative content forms - I can't edit this - should I be able to? Is it possible to delete the bit about the MP3 download?

Promos on Volunteering about hub template - I can still only edit this in Firefox, not in IE8.

Thank you!

Is it possible to delete the bit about the MP3 download? - We'll tackle it as part of this ticket (which omits the need to remove the MP3) http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1034 *will try for this week* 8) Promos on Volunteering about hub template - I can still only edit this in Firefox, not in IE8. - Under investigation *can't guarantee a fix this week*

subject: postcode searching for events [part 1, postcode next to events in search listings]

comments.value:
Hi guys,

This is rearing its ugly little head again.

Some options for you to consider / quote on:

1)      How is Kitsite set up to do a postcode search of the open weekend events?  So if a post code were entered, finding events within a certain radius?

2)      Could we just show the postcode of the event next to the date it's occurring?  Apparently people want to be able to tell at a glance if it's near them

Two is clearly easier than 1.  Please let me know estimates for both!  The OW team will need to pay!

Liz Goulding
New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012

> 1) How is Kitsite set up to do a postcode search of the open weekend events? So if a post code were entered, finding events within a certain radius?

If you mean the CMS then that's a bit of a red herring, as the CMS only allows you to assign a postcode (or lat/long).

I assume you mean can we add a postcode to the front end search, the answer is yes but it's not just a case of adding a postcode field to the form nor do we have some ready to use code to deploy out of the box.

Some sites do this in a hacky way by /trying to/ (it's not accurate) stripping off the first bit of postcode entered up until a latter or space ie. 'N1 4DG' or 'N14DG' and then trying to match any postcode starting with those letters. That however doesn't deal with borders very well ie. N1 next to E8 

The proper way is to do it is to add a lat/long to every event, you get this for free if you use the location picker in the CMS but not from user submitted events. Then when someone does a search we also turn the postcode they entered into a lat/long coordinate and then for each result returned use a bit of maths to work out the distance between the two points and therefore whether it falls within an acceptable radius.

The short answer is no we don't have it and no we couldn't implement it this week.

But if it is a feature you want (and if your dealing with events it does obviously makes sense) we can look at implementing it

Although it would almost certainly take the best part of a week to get up and running as we need to upgrade the search engine, write some wrapper code, update the search form, get the back end of the form to turn the postcode entered into a lat/long, assign lat/longs to all the legacy events, set it up so it does this automatically in future, test, deploy, test etc.

> 2) Could we just show the postcode of the event next to the date it's occurring? Apparently people want to be able to tell at a glance if it's near them


You mean in the results? if so, certainly, mainly (*) just a case of deciding where it goes.

* I think we also need to refresh/republish all the events as I don't think we currently store the postcode in the 'front end' search engine, so we would first need to add it as a indexable field and bulk update all the events so we can pull it back out when people do a search.

Jamie

1) For curiosity for future development, can you quote how long it would take?

2) Yeah, that’s precisely what i mean. I *think* the most sensible place for it to go is next to the date. But can you quote an amount of time and I’ll get the OW team to pay? I think most of the other changes are things that other po’s or the retainer will cover (I’ll need to double check) but this is clearly one for them!

> 1) For curiosity for future development, can you quote how long it would take?

<snip>...it would almost certainly take the best part of a week to get up and running..</snip>

* that may be an underestimate though, just asked Kieran to confirm what is involved in changing the backend of the search engine to handle spacial searches.

> 2) Yeah, that’s precisely what i mean. 

0.3 of a day ?

(* OK adding it will probably take 60 mins, but once we add in sign off on where it goes, make some tweaks, write some CSS, check that CSS works on IE6/7/8 etc. I expect the morning will have disappeared)

Actually Liz,

Hold the front page...

We don't have the postcode in the search index so expect it will take us just under half a day to get this changed.

0.5 day

Jamie

Cool.

For 2) I’ll get confirmation they’re happy to pay £210!
Cool. £350. I’ll go check

They're raising a PO.  Please go ahead with 2) right away!

High priority
PO 9080. Thanks, Liz.

This is now setup, although we haven't yet republished all events

You can see it on this event though
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/upcoming-events/index.php?age=openweekend&owd1=yes&owd2=yes&owd3=yes&regionfilter=&typefilter=&q=King+Harald&x=19&y=7

I did try with a "Postcode:" prefix but it looked a bit heavy handed? Maybe we shoudl split out just he start of the postcode or link it off to the map (I think I have the url to do that somewhere) ?

thoughts

Jamie

Apparently what the *really* wanted was the post-code field to appear under ‘place’ on the individual event details pages. Can we please do that as well? (sorry, i must have misunderstood)

I still think what we’ve done is valuable. I think writing postcode: is necessary ... otherwise it just looks a smidge random?

Hi Liz,

I have added the postcode and made it a hyperlink to the map, I hope that is OK? It just seemed sensible / useful.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/events/the-rat-trail-at-hollytrees-museum-colchester.php

I have also added in 'Postcode:" to the search results page but I wonder if showing region / borough is actually more useful in the search results? I have all three values in the search index now so can change /fairly/ easily if required.

Jamie

Woo hoo. Let’s go live with what’s there now, and i can think about switching the postcode to region/borough in the next few days.

Thanks.
Have we pushed this live / republished all events? If not, might be good to do so tonight? Let me know if you’re planning on it – I’ll need to go and lock a bunch.
Just doign them all now (well only the ones that have been previously published / are currently published)
Ah, cool. Glad you can do it that way – makes my life WAY easier!
Marking as solved.

subject: Change to codes on Specialist application form

comments.value:
I’m so sorry to have to say that the internal client has completely done a 180-degree turn on this.

They are now saying that after discussions yesterday they have decided it would be too confusing for users to have to enter their email address and both a username and password.

I’m really sorry but is there anyway we could change it so applicants only have to enter their email address and a password (which they want to rename as an ‘identifier’) i.e. switch off the group name field.

I can already hear your groan but can you advise:
1)	Is this something which can be done for Monday? And if it’s not, then fine – I can’t believe their timing
2)	Can we also rename the ‘Password’ field label to ‘Identifier’ 
3) We need to change the tooltips - Can we add to the help icon for email address:
"You will need your own email address and you must ensure that no-one else uses the same email address to submit an application." For the identifier help icon, can the help icon read: "Enter the identifier you’ve received". See the diagram attached.


Sorry.......
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".

The local schoolchildren also gained, and shared with their peers, new skills in leadership and responsibility. In the past year they met Her Majesty The Queen 005/her-majesty-the-queen-makes-first-visit-to-london-2012-o.php> , Archbishop Desmond Tutu tutu-visits-the-olympic-park.php> and President Zuma of South Africa esident-of-south-africa-jacob-zuma-visits-olympic-park.php> who were visiting the Park. Some members also attended the launch of the new ArcelorMittal rcelormittal-as-tier-two-supporter.php> Orbit at City Hall. The original 20 members from the 2008 Construction Crew are now project graduates, spread across a number of different London secondary schools. The ODA continues to work with the graduates, most recently taking them on a tour of the Park and to visit the View Tube. Forty new Construction Crew members are now being selected for next year's programme, which starts in September 2010. Again, they are aged ten and are from 20 schools from within the five Host Boroughs. All resources created for the Construction Crew are made available on the London 2012 Education website, Get Set . Construction Crew schools have become a part of the Get Set network, gaining access to new opportunities.
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com

Hi Alex,

It looks liek the page beign linked to has been deleted while George was editing that page, could that be the case?
No, that isn’t the case. The pages haven’t been deleted.

Hi Alex,

Ah I wonder if George is copy/pasting the text in with links ? (the text below has links in it)

I have stripped them out of the text below, can you re-try pasting the test in and then just assigning one link at a a time?

* I would obv. do this for you, but I just tested it and it works for me, so its more to see if it's still an issue for you (or george)

--

The 40 members of this year's Olympic Park Construction Crew are set to 
graduate this summer having learned about London 2012's key themes. The 
local schoolchildren also gained, and shared with their peers, new 
skills in leadership and responsibility. In the past year they met Her 
Majesty The Queen, Archbishop Desmond Tutu and President Zuma of South Africa who were 
visiting the Park. Some members also attended the launch of the new 
ArcelorMittal Orbit at City Hall.

The original 20 members from the 2008 Construction Crew are now project 
graduates, spread across a number of different London secondary schools. 
The ODA continues to work with the graduates, most recently taking them 
on a tour of the Park and to visit the View Tube.

Forty new Construction Crew members are now being selected for next 
year's programme, which starts in September 2010. Again, they are aged 
ten and are from 20 schools from within the five Host Boroughs.

All resources created for the Construction Crew are made available on 
the London 2012 Education website, Get Set 

--
Ok, thanks – we’ll look at tomorrow morning.

subject: Volunteering site - media pod

comments.value:
Hi there

Here are the media pod assets, as discussed. 

Is this all you need?

How easy will this be to integrate so that we can edit the XML?

Grateful for your thoughts!

Morag

Try downloading the files from here: https://london2012.ftpstream.com

Username – commsurvey
Password – c0nf1dence
Hello - is this okay or do you need anything else from me?
Still implementing/testing on the dev server at the moment..

Hi Morag,

We've finally got the pod player in place and working (we had a couple issues with getting the paths to work once we moved it into the CMS)
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/index.php

You can edit the XML file direct here in the CMS (it's in the /data folder at the root of the CMS) if you want a new video/image/text just add another <item> block with the relevant type, images paths take the form of the full path minus the first slash) 
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/coder/data/data.xml

I was about to make an 'special' editor for this file in the CMS but then thought that it's probably only yourself that will update it and once it's live you only add the occasional change to it, so it bay be quicker to just leave you rto edit the XML direct; is that is OK?

One issue, which is OK for now, but may cause issues later on if we ever have another similar player, is the Flash movie is hardcoded to find the data.xml file at the root of the site/cms in a /data folder. It would be better if we could specify where to find the data.xml folder or get the Flash movie to look for it in the same or a sub folder of the Flash movie. To save complexity it may be best to leave as is for the moment, but if we do this again need to remember to let Jonathan know this is an issue.

Any issues just shout !!
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".

Looks great! I am wondering though if we can keep the section nav on the left hand side and get rid instead of the promos down the right hand column. That means people will be able to navigation out of the section and back to other Volunteering content.

subject: Change of URLs from specialist access form

comments.value:
Hi Jamie

For our testing of the password-protected form on Monday, we are going to use a different url (one with an SSL certificate installed on it):

At your end you will need to change the urls from the password entry page through to the ATOS to these:

1/ for specialists i.e. sitting behind the button “apply now” of the login & password page, the url should be

=> https://esitraining.london2012.com/ESIREG/NewFormRequest.do?email=<CAPTURED_EMAIL_ADDRESS>&group=<VOLUNTEER_GROUP_NAME>

2/ for the public i.e. sitting behind the “apply now” button on the volunteer website, the url should be

=> https://esitraining.london2012.com/ESIREG/NewFormRequest.do?group=public

Is it possible to do this in time for Monday please?

Thanks!

Morag
Changed..
Working like a dream – thanks!
Part of volunteering work. Marking as "bill separately".

description:
Hi Jamie

For our testing of the password-protected form on Monday, we are going to use a different url (one with an SSL certificate installed on it):

At your end you will need to change the urls from the password entry page through to the ATOS to these:

1/ for specialists i.e. sitting behind the button “apply now” of the login & password page, the url should be

=> https://esitraining.london2012.com/ESIREG/NewFormRequest.do?email=<CAPTURED_EMAIL_ADDRESS>&group=<VOLUNTEER_GROUP_NAME>

2/ for the public i.e. sitting behind the “apply now” button on the volunteer website, the url should be

=> https://esitraining.london2012.com/ESIREG/NewFormRequest.do?group=public

Is it possible to do this in time for Monday please?

Thanks!

Morag
